review_body: Our first stay at a Japanese hotel. Enjoyed our stay. We had three adults and a child in our party, room is small but adequate. We would stay again. We paid extra for the breakfast and don't regret our choice.

Stayed here for one night before catching my early morning flight back to the UK from the International terminal. I found this hotel to be clean and modern. My single room was compact but comfortable and well equipped. A simple little breakfast was included in the price. There is no bar or restaurant but drinks machines and sitting areas are available. Shuttle bus runs in the morning to the airport free of charge, however you can also access on the Tokyo monorail line. It is only 1 stop to the International terminal.

Great hotel to stay for one night if you are flying out from Haneda early in the morningPros:- clean and new- free shuttle bus from airport to hotel- free welcome drink service - nice breakfastCons:- shuttle bus only available at domestic terminal, if you are flying internationally you need to take another shuttle bus to go from international terminal to domestic terminal- shuttle bus driver has no smile and looks like he doesn't want to drive

Reached Tokyo close to midnight hence we opted for Keikyu inn Haneda. Did not disappoint. Transfer service was seamless to and fro. Hotel was immaculately clean. 3 beds await the family. Even the simple breakfast kept our stomachs warm and filled.

Even though I only stayed for one night, I loved my stay! Came to this hotel as a late night stop before heading into Tokyo and enjoyed the complimentary bus ride to the hotel...when I checked in, the staff heeded all my requests as per my booking. (I’m a very light sleeper so I requested a room far away from the elevator on a high floor and the staff were so kind to give me exactly as requested).The room with the double bed was surprisingly big, and most importantly, clean and pristine. My sister and I were too tired to wake up for the complimentary breakfast so we skipped it. Checkout was a breeze. When my sister realized she left her glasses in the room, we emailed the staff and they couriered the glasses to our hotel in Asakusa. Very friendly staff!Thank you very much for the enjoyable stay and I will be sure to come back on my next Tokyo trip. :)

Nice and modern hotel. Booked here for a night as catching a morning flight. Room is small, cosy and clean. Free shuttle to and from Haneda hotel is great. But the service to airport ends in the morning. If you have big luggages will be a bit inconvenient as you need to exit from the station, cross the bridge to reach the hotel. All in about about 15 min walk. Overall comfortable stay and good if you catching a morning flight.

I sent them message earlier asking if there would be any shuttle available for pick up in early morning. The answer is noSo I took a taxi to the hotel desperate for a rest before the dayThen the receptionist asked me for the check out time. It should be 10am no later or I will have to pay 1100yen. Given that I contacted them earlier for the plan and no one told me about this. I would pay more for this hotel since I could only sleep 4 hours there. 10am strict check out time to me is ridiculous

With no English tv or any place on the premises in which to dine, I would have to say that the hotel is a disappointment. It's fine that the rooms are small; it's a one night stay to expedite passage to the airport, but still.....The nearest restaurant is blocks away! Why they give you pajamas and no water in the room is a curious thing. There is really very little staff to answer questions or provide anything - it's like a self-service hotel, whatever that may be...
user_name:
GEG378
New York City, New York

review_body: Hotel has free shuttle bus service till 9:30. It was great as I needed to get a flight very earlier morning. The bus staff looked so tired though... No smile and even seemed a bit grumpy... Anyway hotel itself was good. Room wasn’t too small. They have a coffee machine near the reception so we could get free coffee when we wanted.

Spent just one night here prior to a Tokyo-US flight but was very impressed with the room size, cleanliness and features. Location is very close to Haneda airport and the free shuttle service to the airport is a bonus. There are a few cafe restaurants in easy walking distance and convenience stores if needed. I would definitely use this hotel again in the future if my travel plans required.

Wonderful location and a free transfer service is provided for the airport. The rooms are good in comparison to other hotels. The breakfast was very disappointing as you get a choice of either Japanese or Western. There is no breakfast buffet.

It's so close to Haneda Airport, I landed around 2 AM in the morning and since there's no train and bus operated at those time, I used taxi to go there (the fare are ¥ 1130)..The overall of hotel are modern and clean, the check in check out process are very easy, the room are comfortable with great view to the airport, the amenities are very complete compared to other hotels I've ever visited (though some of the amenities are located in front of the receptionist area, not in the room)..The airport shuttle bus are in good condition but they don't accept reservation so it's on first come first serve basis, I used it to go back to Haneda after check out..Too bad I don't have time to try their breakfast so I can't reviewed it..

This hotel has a great convenient location to the train station and Haneda Airport. The hotel feels new, modern, high tech. The room I got had a single bed and was really only suitable for 1 person to stay in. My only real complaint was that the elevator will only work if you have a room key, and it will only go to the floor your room is on when you scan your key. This was a challenge as my group was spread out among floors, and I had to get something from one of them. We had to coordinate by meeting in the lobby. The breakfast buffet was nothing special, but did the job, and there was adequate seating as well. Great views of the airport at Haneda as well.

yes room was great nothing to say about it, I would give a 5 stars but breakfast was so disapointing according to the standing of the hotel...you don't have buffet, you can only choose between western or japanese breakfast, only one toast! no viennoiserie, no milk, no fruit juices, only a small piece of fish, nothing to eat...it is a shame. So for the travellers who need to go to the airport I highly recommand to stop by the super hotel at aomonoyokocho who is not far away, direct train, cheaper, very quiet, very well located, you have plenty of restaurants, shops and small temples all around...you will be very satisfied with their service.

Short distance from airport, clean, quiet room. Free shuttle only runs evenings to hotel and mornings back to airport, but taxi was only 900 yen and 5 minute ride. Convenience store and travel cafe about 5 minute walk from hotel. Western or Japanese breakfast choice.

THE HOTEL is a standart Business Hotel. That means you get a bed, a bathroom, breakfast and a quick-checkout in morning for a reasonable price. The breakfast is very simple. You can choose between a western style and a japanese style version. it is nothing fancy but a good start into the day.THE ROOM is a little bit small and only provides the basics: a clean bed and a clean bathroom. But this is all you need, if you stay for on one (or even two) nights. THE LOCATION is perfect for people who have an early flight from Haneda airport or arrive late at night. The hotel is only one train station away from the International Terminal. The hotel also provides a free shuttle bus to the airport in the morning. The train station (Tenkubashi Station) is approx. 300m away from the hotel, and therefore in walking distance even with heavy baggage. There are two train lines available: Keikyu Airport Line and Tokyo Monorail. Both are connecting Haneda Airport with the Yamanote ring; Shinagawa Station for the Keikyu line (some trains become the Toei Asakusa Subway Line and go further to the Sky Tree) and Shimbashi/Hamatsucho für the Monorail (Japan Rail Pass is valid).The hotel doesn't have a restaurant for dinner or a bar. There are not many places for that around the hotel and it is still 30min away from Tokyo city center. Therefore it may not be the best place to stay if you want to discovery Tokyo or if you are looking for a good nightlife time.I choose this hotel for the night before my flight back to Germany. My favorite hotel in Tokyo is close to Yushima Tenmangu and at least 90 min. from the airport. With this hotel I was not worried about rush hour congestion are getting connecting trains. Just breakfast, easy bus shuttle and baggage drop-off at the airport. All within these mentioned 90 min.CONCLUSION: This hotel is an ideal place to stay the night before an early flight from Haneda Airport or after arriving late.

Stayed overnight at the keiku ex inn during our overnight layover at Haneda Airport. The hotel is a very good alternative to the onsite transit hotel which has sky high rates for a basic room. This hotel is just 10 mins away by complimentary shuttle bus from the international terminal. The hotel and rooms are nice and clean. A very comfortable airport hotel to overnight to catch your next flight in the morning. I surely recommend it. Will stay here again if I have a long overnight transit. Note: this hotel is outside the airport and you need to clear immigration to get to the hotel and vice versa.

We have stayed here before and did not hesitate to book again. The rooms are clean and modern looking. The included breakfast is a choice of Asian or Western. There is a coffee machine and teabags and other personal items available free at reception. There are vending machines selling everything from food to soft drink and beer and even a laundry and ice machine. We used the shuttle service to the airport which is free and it was very efficient. Absolutely have not hesitation recommending this hotel.

I stayed here one night to avoid the peak time train in the morning. The hotel locates within Haneda International Airport. It is quite pricy for me but the location is so convenient that cannot be beaten by any other hotels. Getting out the hotel and you are at the departure lounge. The hotel and room are very clean and the staff are friendly and polite as you expect in high standard Japanese hotels. The check in & out are very quick.I would recommend it to anyone who prefers a good sleep and the smoothest departure on the following morning.

wonderful clean hotel with all the right amenities and easy access to hotel. two blocks from subway access. nice breakfast and very nice rooms. one subway stop from airport or a 10 dollar cab ride. very nice staff.

We needed a hotel near the haneda airport for a layover. There are 2 airport hotels in haneda airport itself. Royal Park Haneda was very expensive for a twin bed room almost 25,000 ¥ for a night. The other first cabin hotel was something like a capsule.. Not suitable for families.We found keikyu ex Inn on trip advisor.. The distance to the airport /modern and well equipped room /free shuttle to airport attracted us to book 2 nights (we arrived on 25 May 1am and had to book 2 nights as our flight is leaving 26 May 6am. It was around $15000 JPY per night. The shuttle bus only operates in the morning to the airport (starts at 430am) and every 30mins there is 1.And in the evening from airport to hotel and last bus ends at 11pm. We had to take a cab to the hotel when we arrived at 1am, it was about 900¥. The rooms are big enough for japanese standards.. The twin beds are wider than usual (160cm wide) we push the beds together and it could sleep 4 of us comfortably. 2 adults 2 kids,The room has a clean and modern feel, the washroom is very clean too with a very modern and high tech wc. The beds are very comfortable.The hotel is a 5mins walk from the nearest train station and note that the walk to the station is uncovered so bring a brolly if is raining.You have to change lines if you are going towards Harajuku / Shibuya area. It takes about 45mins to reach downtown.The shuttle bus in the morning takes about 10mins to reach the domestic terminal in haneda. It gets fairly crowded in the morning so get down to the B1 level early to queue up for the bus. We took the 5am bus and there were already 8 people ahead of us at 450am. The bus can take about 25 pax and no reservations is allowed. You can check out in B1 too. Is an automated machine... Just slot in your key card.Only small grouse is the breakfast is not buffet breakfast and is very limited. Basically 2 choices.. Japanese or international and Japanese comes with a bowl of udon/some condiments and that's it. Small portions. But is OK for us. Not a deal breaker.This hotel is highly recommended for a short layover while you wait for your next flight at haneda based on my view and experience. If you are looking for a hotel so to visit downtown Tokyo for shibuya/harajuku /ueno/mejji/disney for a longer stay.. You should look elsewhere as it is not near to those places.

If your flight is early in the morning from Haneda, I recommend this hotel to stay. They have a good shuttle service to/from the airport (all terminals). They have good facilities and provide you from very good ammeties that you as a traveler might appreciate a lot! The breakfast was not really good, the portions were very small. Enjoy!

Very nice hotel with really pleasant, friendly staff. Clean and well appointed. I was surprised at how spacious the room was. Smaller than American standard, but much larger than I had expected. I loved it and would stay there again.

We stayed here after a long flight from Toronto to Haneda. We had another flight out to Hokkaido the next morning.Super fast check in, very clean room, comfy bed. Walking distance from the train and the breakfast was very convenient!

Due to our early flight out we booked here.First if your like us a rely on google maps, do yourself a favour and look up and find the motel and find the path that way..lol.Firstly check in fast, check out is a card machine that you just pop your room key into and your checked out.The room having been in Japan hotels for the past week, was really big. Bed comfy, pyjamas are just funny to use but makes you feel special. Bathroom etc were very clean, a little outdated however it’s really only a room for a night for us.The breakfast is where they lose the one star. Option of western or Japanese. Neither looked appetising, however can eat.The coffee here was unpleasant and I wished I brought change and just grabbed a cold can out of vending machine.If your a light sleeper like me the airport noise maybe a little to much.There’s also a 711 down the road if your not finding what you want in the vending machines on your floorsShuttle bus very convienet for the airport but a lot of people using this service.Will use this hotel again if in Japan and this is my airport.

We stayed here for one night as we had an early domestic flight the next morning. Five of us fit into compact room that had everything we needed, even a mini-seating area to watch TV and eat our take-out curry. Enjoyed the kimono robes and slippers. Kids got a kick out of the heated, high-tech toilets. There’s a Family Mart, cash machine and a couple of little places to eat within walking distance. Free coffee and tea in the lobby and a shuttle to and from the airport make for a worry-free stay.Easy, breezy and a great start to our trip!

The rooms are excellent, spacious (for Japanese standards of course) and very clean. The check-in process could only start at 3pm, so if you get here early, then good luck! The breakfast was a disgrace. Tiny portions and if you wanted more, then tough luck.

I stayed one night for a transfer to Narita Airport, my first night ever in Japan, and was pleasantly surprised by the size, quality, and price of the room, and the service of the staff. Everyone was very friendly. Others have complained about the size of the breakfast, but I enjoyed another first for me: fish for breakfast! The free shuttle to the airport was another bonus.

Hotel offers free shuttle service to and from the airport as well as free breakfast (either Japanese or American). The room is comfortable and convenient. We will be going there again later this month.

I have been to many hotels in Japan and I this has to be the best business hotel twin room ever. Massive room and bathroom. Build end of 2017 so still so new!!Breakfast was either Japanese or western and adequate.

I stayed at the Keikyu for an overnight stay on a business trip. The hotel was very close to the airport. It is a very new & clean hotel. The location is nice and quite for a good nights sleep. Another positive is that the rooms are quite large for Japan. Probably the main negative is the small size of the breakfast. You may need a 2nd breakfast when you get to the airport.

The Keikyu EX Inn is quite close to Haneda. One can take a free airport shuttle, or the train or monorail. The hotel is a short 5 minute walk from the monorail station. Overall, the rooms are on the large size for Japan. Maybe the largest I've seen in Japan (but still small compared to the US). The hotel is fairly new, and is very clean and comfortable. On the negative size, the breakfast was not so good. The amount of food was small. A choice was provided between Japanese and Western, but the Western breakfast was more like "less Japanese". There doesn't seem to be food choices within easy walking distance. I'd recommend eating at Haneda if you are going or coming from that location.

This hotel was amazing! We arrived in Haneda around 10pm and took the hotel shuttle from the airport to the hotel at 11:40. We flew in from Osaka so we flew in domestically. The shuttle was on time, quick and efficient. Unfortunately, there aren’t any 24/7 restaurants nearby and we were hungry. Luckily there are 7-Eleven vending machines on the second floor, the same floor as the front desk, in the breakfast room. The breakfast served the next morning was good too! They served a western choice or a Japanese choice. We opted for the western - bacon, eggs, butter and jellies, beef soup (?) and a custard. Random, but good enough. The beds were comfortable and the bathroom was nice. The toilet was very impressive. WiFi speed was strong! Also, being smokers, we really appreciated that there was an indoor smoking room located conveniently nearby the lobby. The front desk agent got a taxi for us quickly as well when we asked how to get a taxi. It was very appreciated! We definitely recommend this hotel. Everything was exceptional. From the basic toiletries offered in the lobby, to the convenient smoking room, the fresh coffee offered 24/7, this hotel was excellent. They thought of nearly everything to make their guests comfortable. I’d also like to add that I saw in previous reviews that there are not self service laundry facilities in this hotel, which is untrue. Nearby the front desk on the second floor are vending machines and washing machines. Very convenient!

Booked a room for 4. After adding the 2 additional beds, there is hardly any space to open the luggage bags. I had to place my opened luggage bag on the sofa. Luckily it’s only for one night. Room was nicely decorated and the toilet was impressive. Hardly any restaurants nearby, have to walk 10-15 mins to the street where all the restaurants are. Free shuttle to Haneda airport starts at 4plus am, first come first serve basis, so do go down to the waiting area early.

Quick efficient check in and check out. Rooms are small and clean. Room card is used in lift to take you straight to your floor (no floor selection required). Very convenient for the airport with a regular shuttle bus. 2 negatives: nothing of interest around the hotel (apart from the airport) so I'd expect more than a handful of local channels (and pay to view films) on the TV; the breakfast is a set (firmly fixed) Japanese or Western (included sweetcorn soup!?) style affair, you pick up 1 of 2 pre-set trays.

Conveniently located near the Haneda airport with free shuttle bus even during the late hours of the evening and early morning. Decent sized room and had two options of western or japanese style for breakfast.

You can stay here for the first night if you arrive at haneda late in the night as the hotel was convenient to Haneda Airport with free airport pickup. It's also a very clean hotel with polite staff speak English well. The room was larger than the average Japanese room and the bed was with good quality. There are also vending machines for food and drinks.In general, very convenient.

My ANA Flight arrived at Haneda 11pm and my next flight will be 5pm next day from Narita airport. I had my luggage stored at airport, so next morning I plan to take a limo bus to Narita. Getting on the hotel shuttle bus and checked in the room easily. I got the room on 7 floor with the nice night-view.As same as other hotels in Japan, room is small but very everything is installed. Very clean. Breakfast choice is western or Japanese style. Both are simple.

Had an Airport View Room and looked down at fishing Boats on the canal and out to the Harbour. Huge room for Japanese Hotel and King Bed. Luxurious.Free good Breakfast but no dining in evening. Short walk to convenience stores and restaurants. Short Walk to Monorail but Hotel does have free Shuttle early mornings and in the Evenings for guests. We were very surprised how lovely this hotel was. Pyjamas supplied. Room Safe. Fridge, kettle (unlimited tea coffee supplies in reception area) Free wifi. We found it cheap Airport Hotel.

This hotel is very handy for those wanting to be close to the airport - without paying premium airport prices. It is very much a boutique service and they have very skeletal staff since it is meant to be very light touch from a service perspective. Beds are comfortable and the wifi is adequate. TV service is very basic for english speakers - only Youtube news so be prepared. There are no self laundry facilities here either.It can be tricky to get to the first time you arrive as the natural tendency will be to walk across the main roads to get to it. There is actually a shorter route across the bridge to the station. There is a local store to the right of the hotel (from front) so makes sense to grab your essentials here. Breakfast was quite disappointing as there was very little choice. You were given 2 choices - Japanese or western. You got a plate and neither was particularly great. The western option was basically toast and a frankfurter. Still, if using this place as a transitory location, it does the job. For those who need to mail something back before travelling - such as a wifi router, there is a mailbox in the street directly behind the hotel.
user_name:
highimpactuk
Welwyn Garden City, United Kingdom

review_body: This has to be one of the best airport hotels I've ever used. Everythingnis set up to make your transit as simple as possible. Close proximity to the monorail and a free shuttle bus out of hours. In addition, the beds, TVs and bathroom are great.

Airport hotels cater to people who stay overnight, leave the next morning and anything else is a bonus. The Keikyu EX Inn has a number of things in its favor -- it's about 5 minutes walk from the subway or monorail station, quite an easy walk even with bags; you can look out over the Haneda airport and the fishing boat harbor; breakfast (basic) is supplied; and there's a shuttle bus service to the Haneda airport. The rooms are big by Japanese standards and the bathrooms are clean. In all, it does everything you could want an airport hotel to do.

Excellent hotel, fairly new. A few minutes from Heneda Airport. Includes Breakfast everyday. Fresh pajamas delivered everyday with slippers. 3 minute walk to the Monorail we used to get to all our site seeing destinations.

A new very clean airport hotel near Tokyo Haneda Airport. The cheapest rooms are very small but space is effectively utilized. The beds are very comfortable, bathroom is compact but they have a small tub with very hot water. The breakfast is not anything western but edible. A Family Mart is a block away. A shrine is nearby also.

check-in was quick and without issues. Room was clean and comfortable, size is not big just like any other tokyo hotel. TV where u can watch VOD videos, set your own wakeup call at your convenience. Welcome coffee and hot water available for drinking at the reception, though you do have your own kettle in the room. Simple breakfast that starts early in the morning to get you started for the day. Simple self checkout process w an electronic booth right beside the waiting room for the free airport shuttle to Haneda Airport. All in all had a good stay for a hotel near to the airport for an early flight the next day!

Very nice, clean, professionally ran hotel. reasonably priced with a free breakfast. It is located in handy reach of the Haneda Airport by monorail and has a free shuttle service. The staff were very strict on the 3pm check in and wouldn't let us into the room even half hour early and there wasn't much close by so is really for overnight stays for airport users.

We do not usually stay at hotels, we are more budget friendly hostel people, but decided to get a really good night's sleep before traveling back to Sweden (15h). The room was really clean and nice, nothing to complain about there.However I did find the breakfast horrible! You could choose between Japanese style and western style and since I don't really like fish for breakfast went with the western one. It consisted of: flavorless white toast with margarine, vegetarian minestrone soup, 1 egg and 2 small sausages. Vending machine coffee or tea was also available. None of this is what I usually eat for breakfast and only the soup had a pleasant flavor.

I got the Yamanote line to Hamamatsucho station for 200 Yen and then the Tokyo Monorail to Tenkubashi station (get the local service) for about 430 Yen. The hotel was a five minute walk away, and if you need a convenience store, there is one just down the road a few minutes further.The room was slightly larger than the average Japanese room and the bathroom standard for a Japanese hotel. Check in was quick, and there are plenty of toiletries in the foyer if you have already packed for departure. The bed was good quality and the room very quiet for a great night's sleep before departure. There are also vending machines for food and drinks, WiFi is brilliant.There is a free coach service to Haneda Airport starting at 4am, departing from the basement floor. There is a lounge on that floor with seating, and you check out by placing your room card in the machine. The coach is right on time - I took the 4.30am coach and it took five minutes to get to the terminal.Breakfast is also included - I didn't have the chance to try it. A great airport hotel with a brilliant bus system.

Free airport pickup, clean, new hotel to stay for a night. We arrived late and pick up rental car next morning, it’s just 100m away from Toyota car rental. Very convenient in our case. Breakfast included.

連続日帰り出張の中日で利用させて頂きました。羽田空港からお迎えバスがあり便利で、ホテルはキレイで気持ちよく過ごせました。しかし、Wifiのスピードが極端に遅く、全く使えませんでした。私の感覚的にはWifiが無いと同じだと思います。また、朝食はビュッフェ式ではなく和・洋定食からの選択。私の洋定食を選びましたが、量も少なめで私的には微妙でした。翌日はホテルのバスで、空港まで送って頂きました。送迎バスがあり、値段は安く、施設もキレイなので、寝るだけならいいかなという印象です。The hotel serves a free shttle bus to Haneda Airport, also it is clean facility.For me, there are two negative point. First, wifi does not work. The speed is so slow. You shoud think they don't have wifi service. Second, free break fast is not satisfy.

The hotel had spacious rooms, was brand new, great amenities and clean. Nice personnel as well. Breakfast was not worth waiting for as it was very simple with no options. Easy to get to the monorail, and free transfer to the airport in the morning (no transportation after 10:30). High speed wifi.

It’s very close to a mono rail and a train line station as well as being close to the airport. Only 10mins away on a free shuttle bus running from 4am-9:30am. Room and bed was small but the it was all very clean and comfortable. Free coffee in the lobby which was also a nice touch. Would stay here again prior an early morning flight.

If you arrive at haneda late in the night, the JR pass office is already closed so it makes sense to just stay at a nearby hotel. Keikyu Ex Inn is a good choice. And behind the hotel you can find a Family Mart!

The hotel is situated near airport and quite quiet at night .Hotel is friendly and easy to check out easily. Simple breakfast is served at 2/F from 5 am and shuttle bus to International airport only takes 8 mins . Room is small and clean.overall is best for short stay either late or morning flight.

Hotel is quite new, so rooms are clean and nice. Breakfast is nothing to look forward to...Rooms are not large and the price is not a bargain. Restaurant is only for breakfast. Staff is nice and friendly. They have a shuttle-bus to the airport, which is very helpful.

Stayed here due to our next day flight timing. Close to Haneda Int'l Airport and they provide free shuttle bus to and from the airport (Must check bus schedule, not 24 hour service).Room is standard business hotel size in Japan, perhaps approx. 15 sqm for standard room with semi-double (similar to queen size).Room amenities are standard in Japan. Full bath amenities, 2 piece PJ, coffee and tea making facility, air purifier, hair dryer, mini-fridge, in-room slippers. No bottled water.There is 7-11 (Convenient store) vending machine in the hotel, so that guests can buy some staffs conveniently 24/7.There is complimentary coffee (from coffee maker) at lobby level (2nd Floor), also varieties of extra amenities such as hair band, hair cream etc...) for guests.Our plan was inclusive of breakfast, can choose from Japanese or Western.Descent quality.This hotel probably be our regular hotel when we need to stay overnight due to flight timing.

Stayed for a night as arriving late night. There’s shuttle bus from international airport to hotel at certain timing and very convenient. Or few minutes walk from the nearest train station (maybe there’s another exit but I have to carry luggage up the stairs). A convenience store few minutes walk.Check in was smooth and room was in decent size and it’s CLEAN! Only one minor thing is I can hear the snoring from next room but overall I think the sound insulation is good.Didn’t try the breakfast.The shuttle bus service (early morning and late night) to airport is great! Very efficient.Would recommend those who need to stay near the airport.

We stayed here during our last two nights in Tokyo. We wanted a hotel near Haneda since we have an early flight. This hotel was perfect. Clean, affordable, near family mart and other resto. Train station is also walking distance so it’s still easy if you want to explore other parts of Tokyo. They have english speaking staff and provide free coffee and tea plus an array of ither essentials which you can get within the reception floor anytime. The PJs are the best too bad they’re not for sale

This hotel was perfect for what I needed. I arrived very late and missed the last shuttle, but the taxi ride was around ¥1000. The front desk staff were friendly and helpful when I went to check in. The room was incredibly clean and the bed was comfortable. It was quiet as well. The breakfast in the morning is a set menu, either Japanese or Western and was quite good. There are coffee and tea machines in the restaurant and lobby available 24 hours. The shuttle back to the airport the next morning was incredibly helpful as well. Will book again when I have a late arrival into Haneda!

The hotel was convenient to Haneda Airport. I took the train to Tenkūbashi and it was about a five minute walk from there. The room was small but had all the amenities needed. The room I was in would have been a bit tight for two but was great for just me. The Japanese breakfast was great. The service was good. I would stay again.

Placed in version Type A of a room even though I was booked into a Type B. Both rooms are the same apart from Type B is for two people and yes, there was two of us. I had booked this to get a good nights sleep prior to flying back t the UK. I was given an extra pillow when i questioned only one pillow being on a double bed and they kindly gave me one but by the time I'd realized we also only had one towel, one set of everything it was late and I was undressed. To top it off I had to go and complain again when I refused a breakfast for two! On the breakfast point, don't bother, it is horrendously bad for westerners. They may as well not bother.

Our flight into Japan was landing at midnight. We didn't want the hassle of navigating our way around after a long-haul flight so opted to book in at a hotel close to the airport. The hotel was spotlessly clean, conveniently located, affordable and very comfortable. I'm a very difficult traveller to please but this hotel gets a big thumbs-up from me.

My family of four got two rooms because we had an early flight out of Haneda. Check in was no problem as the desk person spoke passable English. I asked for information on the free shuttle bus and she gave me a sheet with very clear directions. I then asked about local restaurants and she gave me a map and said most were about a 10 minute walk, which was true.The rooms were very clean and new. I couldn't figure out all of the controls, but was able to eventually get everything working. They have a wake up call feature on the tv.Since we took the bus at 5:00 we missed the free breakfast. The bus left promptly at 5:00 and at that time of day took about 10 minutes at most.I did not hear any noise through the walls and the location was very convenient to Haneda. You can see the monorail station right across the small river if you are not able to take the shuttle.

Everything in this hotel is great except that the windows & door is not soundproof. It is very new & very clean. Everything in the room is very high tech. Location is just 1 station away from Haneda international terminal. Shuttle bus is available at certain timings.

I love this hotel. It was so clean and nice. I had the view of the airport, river and train. The bed is super comfortable. The toilet and bathroom is so spacious. The breakfast is fast and simple. Just right for catching an early morning flight. Check out at machine just before boarding the free airport shuttle service. To arrive at the hotel , Tekunbashi station on the Keikyu line, Haneda airport express line from Shingawa. Good rate for comfort and convenience.

We stayed here for one night after a flight from Perth. The motel is on the edge of the airport and less than $10.00 AUD taxi fare. They do have a free shuttle bus from the airport but limited from the international one. The room is compact but there is enough room for suitcases and it is well laid out. It is also very clean and new looking and no noise can be heard from nearby aircraft. There are plenty of vending machines in the hotel including some that sell beer and sandwiches and snacks. The breakfast (included in room price) is a choice between western and Asian and is a good size meal. The hotel is well located near supermarkets and the train station.

We were arriving late into Haneda and so didn't want to travel far, and it was also convenient enough for the single day we were spending in town before moving onInitial feel was like an upmarket english Travelodge or Premier Inn, but with lots of extrasEg toothbrush and paste, shaving kit, pyjamas, flannel, air con, air purifying machine, torch !,Small by British standards but adequate immaculatly cleanWe left a do not disturb/clean note on door when we went out and when we got back there was fresh linen, toiletries, pyjamas, slippers etc in a carrier bag outside our door! Breakfast a bit unusual - Japanese or Western, but not sure how a soup gets onto a western breakfast? But the yoghurt and the toast was nice. Didn't eat the sausage and egg either.Tea, coffee available in reception and kettle in roomFood vending machine in lobbyOnly 1 monorail stop from Haneda, but free shuttle bus in morning til 9.30 and evening after 6ishA very nice stay

As we were going to spend 2 nights in Tokyo before flying on to Chitose for our Niseko ski vacation, we decided to stay at a hotel near Haneda airport for convenience for the early morning departure to Chitose. My husband chanced upon this new hotel that was opened in 2017 that was at a reasonable rate of S$130 per night per room for 2 persons which was 1 train station away. There is free shuttle from Haneda airport to the hotel if you arrive from 18:20 to 23:40 and depart from the hotel for the airport from 4:00 to 9:30. The room was very neat, clean and tidy with minimalist styling that was efficient. Lighting was good with sufficient brightness when required with ambient lighting available. Air conditioning and bath facilities were good and comfortable. Breakfast was simple but good with a choice of Western or Japanese. We had saba, vegetable soup, rice and pickles for our Japanese breakfast on the first morning. The walk to the train station is about 5 mins and it was very convenient to go down into the city. For the time we had, we managed to visit Shibuya, Harajuku, Ginza and Tsukiji. Checking in and out was efficient and convenient. The family was very satisfied with the comfortable stay we had.

I stayed in this hotel prior to a flight home to the UK. It’s easy to get to on the Keikyu line (the last stop before the airport) and via the monorail then it’s a little walk to the hotel. You can see Haneda across the road it’s that close. Check in was fine and as I arrived early and wanted to sightsee in Tokyo I paid the extra ¥1100 per extra hour to check in. Although you can leave the luggage at the desk and check in later (I was just doing early check in for convenience) The lobby had free hot drinks and any hotel toiletries you may need. it’s a short walk to the nearest convenience store and there is also a local shrine that you can visit. But checking in and going back into Tokyo is easy enough if you want to make the most of your remaining time. The breakfast was not the best and is limited to Japanese or European option rather than a buffet so I wasted much of it. But that was down to my fussiness The room was spacious, although cool and I struggled with the gadgets (temperature and alarm) as both were in Japanese with not English interpretation as I’ve seen in other hotels. Lastly I was a solo traveller which means 1 pillow so I did have to ask for an extra which unfortunately was like a brick. So my last nights sleep was not the most comfortable as I was chilly and had very small and uncomfortable pillows. This hotel is brand new and although the staff were very helpful and polite the breakfast and comfort of the room let it down for me. I am not sure I would stay again as I have stayed in a more comfortable one 5 minutes up the road!this hotel also offered a free shuttle to Haneda terminals

Nice hotel, very convenient, near the monorail (5min from Haneda airport and the station is at 2 min walk) you can also take the same monorail to reach Tokyo .Very clean and very nice .Convenient store 1 min walk.I highly recommend if you have a short stay .

New Hotel, clean with free shuttle bus to the airport at late night. Only 5 minutes from Haneda Airport. Easy access to Tokyo city. The room is bigger than standard. Helpful staffs. I can only say that Superb ! Exceeded expectations.

Stayed here on the way to catch our flight back to Europe. Had two days and the night in between to see Tokyo. It’s located very well for Haneda Airport, but getting to Tokyo is a challenge (maybe I couldn’t grasp the system though). Official check in is at 3 pm, we arrived at 2.45 and we were made to wait till 3 pm by receptionist. We then noticed that many other people standing around were told the same. This seemed rather petty. Once we were able to access our room, it was clean, simple and fairly big given Tokyo standards. Bathroom was bit silly & was clearly a whole bathroom box fitted into the room. We were bit disturbed by people sleeping in the room next to us, seems walls are pretty thin. We didn’t wake up early enough to check the breakfast. Given this seems to be a brand new hotel, I’m sure they’ll sort bits and pieces to be better / given Tokyo prices and standards, it was still money very well spent. Oh, they provide limited airport transfer, which don’t matter much given it is one metro stop away from Haneda.

The hotel was clean and spacious ; fully furnished and well equipped with all amenities. The hotel staff is nice and helpful, yet it took quite a bit of time to check it. You have to wait for at least 20 mins for check in if you are the last one to get out of the shuttle bus. There is a family mart just across the hotel; some eateries in walking distance so you won't be starving. Anyway the hotel provides simple breakfast. It is worthwhile as a transit hotel, which provides shuttle bus from the Airport. Just hope that the shuttle bus will extend its operating hours to and from the hotel. I would recommend this hotel.

LocationHotel is located about 5 minutes drive from Tokyo International HND airport in the town of Haneda. They run a shuttle bus schedule every 30-minutes or so from domestic terminal, see my photo for times. Within the town of Haneda there are a few convenience stores, some bars and some Japanese restaurants, all with walking distance. There is a train station as well, plus monorail to get into central downtown Tokyo. From the hotel room you can get a nice view of the airport. RoomThe room was a double bed and since hotel is brand new it was spotless and modern. More generous in size compared to neighbouring hotels I have stayed at the mystay and JAL city. The double bed is comfy of good size and has special very comfortable pocket coil (similar to Airweave) mattress. It is designed for optimal comfort sleeping. Either side are helpful bedside tables with full room light switches & plug sockets Flexible personal reading lights well. Facing bed is the large desk area with a huge TV but unfortunetly couldn't find any international TV that wasn't in Japanese language only. There is a small fridge, kettle, air purifier and open wardrobe with coat hangers and mirror. A chair is also offered with small table. AC is remote controlled and above and is somewhat a little noisy. The bathroom is standard modern Japanese with deep short bath and shower. Shisedio amenities and most items such as dental kits etc. However at reception, they also offer a box with say vanity kits, mouthwash clothes dust remover sheet and even shower gel. Overall the business traveller room is fairly nice and spacious (for Japan) and has a great view of the airport. The comfortable bed is the highlight. FacilitiesThe hotel has personal routers for WIFI to each room and worked fast. In the lobby is a currency machine, plus a room with plenty of washer and dryers (takes 2 hours and costs 500 yen without need for clothes cleaner- very handy). You can give out iron's and ironing boards here but also on each floor I noticed trouser press to take to room etc. There is a smoking room and also free coffee machine plus teas in the lobby. No leisure facilities though. Various vending machines for drinks and even t-shirts in the washer room. Breakfast hall is near lobby in a sort of airline looking lounge that can be used anytime. there are 7-11 vending machines in there. Breakfast consists of either japanese meal tray (Mackeral and rice) or Western (Egg and ham with toast) - both with soup and choice of small bowl of beans or fruit. Its ok but its very much set as to what you can have etc. StaffStaff mostly speak English well, polite with an efficient check-in process. Overall would stay again, they offer a comfortable bed in a brand new spotless business hotel convenient for Tokyo HND airport. Fast washer and dryer on site and special bed mattress were highlights.
